info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 14 at 6:21AM PDT until October 14 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, Los Angeles and Ventura.
* WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Malibu, Woodland Hills, Agoura Hills, Encino, Chatsworth, Santa Monica, Northridge, Van Nuys, Venice, Beverly Hills, Culver City and North Hollywood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING
